summary: This document is an exhibit containing email correspondence and draft plea documents from September 2007 between defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz and Assistant U.S. Attorney Marie Villafaña, discussing the negotiation of charges and plea agreement for Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a draft Information charging Epstein with witness harassment and assault, and a draft Plea Agreement outlining a proposed 18-month federal sentence and a related state plea requiring sex offender registration.

keyFacts: The draft plea agreement proposed an 18-month federal prison sentence for Epstein, followed by two years of supervised release and a $200,000 fine.

Epstein was to also plead guilty in state court to solicitation of minors for prostitution, requiring sex offender registration and a recommended 30-month sentence (20 months prison, 10 months community control).
The federal charges were limited to one count of witness harassment (18 U.S.C. § 1512) and one count of simple assault (18 U.S.C. § 113).
The agreement required Epstein to waive all rights to appeal or collaterally attack his sentence.
The U.S. agreed to provide a list of up to 40 identified minor victims to Epstein's attorneys after sentencing and to appoint a guardian ad litem for them.
